title: Data Science Experience
text:

title: Courses
text:
DATS 6103: Data Mining
        This course introduces basic concepts of data mining as applied to Data Science, using Python as the programming language. Key algorithms covered include Linear/Logistic Regression (LR), Decision Trees (DT), Random Forests (RF), K-Nearest Neighbors (KNN), Support Vector Machines (SVM) and K-Means, with hands-on projects and real-world applications.
        
    
            
               July 2025
            
            
            
               DM
            
            
            
               Course Website
            
            
    
      
        
      
      
        Math for Data Science
        This course introduces fundamental mathematical concepts for Data Science. Key subjects covered include Set Theory, Linear Algebra, Calculus and Probability, with real-world interview questions.
        
    
            
               May 2025
            
            
            
               Data Science Bootcamp
            
            
            
               Course Website
            
            
    
      
        
      
      
        Programming for Data Science
        This course introduces fundamental programming concepts for Data Science. Key programming languages covered include Python, R and SQL, with real-world interview questions.
        
    
            
               May 2025
            
            
            
               Data Science Bootcamp
            
            
            
               Course Website
            
            
    
      
        
      
      
        DATS 6450: Reinforcement Learning
        This course introduces reinforcement learning through classical and deep architectures. Key algorithms covered include Monte Carlo (MC), Temporal Difference (TD), Value Function Approximation (VFA), Deep Q-Networks (DQN), Vanilla Policy Gradient (VPG), Proximal Policy Optimization (PPO), and Monte Carlo Tree Search (MCTS), with hands-on projects and real-world applications.
        
    
            
               December 2024
            
            
            
               RL
            
            
            
               Course Website

title: Projects
text:
Fairfax County Public Schools Dashboard
        This project presents an interactive Streamlit dashboard analyzing Fairfax County Public Schools (FCPS) meal data, featuring production trends, sales insights, and future opportunities for data-driven decision-making.

        Optimization Foundations
        This project applies optimization techniques using NumPy to optimize multidimensional functions. Key optimization algorithms covered include Gradient Descent, Linear Minimization, Newton's Method and Conjugate Gradient.

        Neural Network Foundations

title: More Stuff About Me
text:
Research Interests
The research topics I am interested are:

Statistical Learning üìä
Neural Networks üß†
Recurrent Neural Networks üß† + ‚è≥
Graph-Neural Networks üß† + üîó
Bandit Algorithms üé∞
Reinforcement Learning ü§ñ

My research is motivated by designing systems that can infer, predict, recommend, and aid human decision-making. My interests revolve around systems that are adaptive, robust, handle non-stationarity, ensure safe exploration, and optimize across multiple objectives. The goal behind my research is to address real-world challenges in finance, economics, healthcare, education and human decision-making.

title: Research
text:
Predicting Postoperative Complications in Laparoscopic General Surgery Using Machine and Deep Learning: A Classification Approach
        This research paper develops and evaluates machine learning and deep learning models to predict six critical postoperative complications: Cardiac Arrest, Myocardial Infarction, Pulmonary Embolism, Reintubation, Pneumonia, and Failure to Wean from Ventilator. 
        
    
            
               May 2025
            
            
            
               ML
            
            
            
               GitHub
            
            
    
      
        
      
      
         A Benchmark for Graph-Based Dynamic Recommendation Systems
        This research paper aims to provide a comprehensive benchmarking framework for evaluating the performance of graph-based dynamic recommendation systems. Key algorithms covered SAGE (GraphSAGE), GAT (Graph Attention Networks), GIN (Graph Isomorphism Networks), and additional state of the art Graph Neural Network architectures.
        
    
            
               May 2024
            
            
            
               GNN
            
            
            
               GitHub
            
            
            
               Research Paper
